history.content:
Don't do this. If it will take you 12-14 hours of work a day, it is not worth it at all. The only people I would trust to take this schedule, would find it on the easy side as they already know a lot of the material. 

You are setting yourself up for failure in upper divs later, and won't get the most out of the course even if you scrape by.

children.subject: ^ I mean, there aren't office hours from HKN in the summer. Reading your post again, I'm not entirely sure if that's what you meant. Anyways, there are definitely office hours held by course staff in summer!
HKN tutoring and office hours are not available over summer (at least in the past)
Hey thanks for sharing your experience. It made me reconsider. Would you mind sharing the percentage you received for the class over the summer??

I am thinking of aiming for As for both and hopefully end up having Bs. I guess it seems feasible as you got A+ on 70?
What do you think?

Ya if you're set on this schedule, you'll do great! You seem highly motivated, if you focus on learning the material and putting in effort, the result will only be beneficial for you.

For 70, don't discount the material as being not beneficial. I use a lot of the material in my upper division courses. The material after the first midterm should be really helpful in ML/AI related material.

For 61a, even if you have experience, it does a great job at giving you difficult(yet 1-5 lines of code) problems to solve. It's very fun, and it's a wonderful first CS class experience at Cal. Definitely attend labs and discussions for both.

Welcome to Berkeley :)

I spent 8-12 hours everyday just for 70 when I took it over the summer. I knew someone who did your schedule, but I think they got C's or something like that, barely slept, possibly took stimulants like caffeine or other things, and seemed miserable. I personally recommend you drop 61a, take 70, and take 61b and 61a and 16a your first semester. That schedule is also very difficult, but manageable. 16a and 61a are not the biggest time consumers, but all 3 will be.

Anyways, if you decide to take this course load, there will be office hours for 70 and 61a, but the office hours may be very crowded during the summer. At least for 70, they were.
Neither took caffeine or stimulants, looked miserable, barely slept, or got C's.. I should note also.

Evident from this comment and my comment above, it will largely depend on you. The two people in this example: 1 is extremely intelligent(which can mean and be derived from many things, but the point is, this person does really well in certain regards), and the other had great experience.

I had 0 probability and stat background when I was taking the course, for example, and was struggling immensely during those aspects of the course. I had peers who breezed through it.

I think my friend might have taken data 8 prior to this summer of 61a and 70, but that would have been his only exposure to any of the material. I definitely think people can excel and learn a lot taking these two together, but I wouldn't recommend it to anyone.

I don't think it matters whether you are a transfer or not. You are someone who was accepted into Cal, you're awesome, and you'll do great during your time here :)

Thank you so much for sharing your experience and wholesome comment lol.
As I am not an extremely intelligent person, I'm gonna try to do some prep work for 70 before the class starts. And I'll shoot for As and hopefully receives at least Bs.
I'm glad you believe people can excel and learn a lot taking these two together.
Wish me luck!

A friend of mine who was a visiting exchange student took CS61A and CS70 together in the summer and received A's in both. He worked almost completely during waking hours. He also had some background in probability, statistics, and python programming. It is possible with background. I also know of another student who took CS61A and CS61C during the summer, receiving A's in both-- though he's one of the smartest people I know. 
It's definitely possible to do well taking two of the introductory CS courses over the summer as a transfer. Just know it'll be difficult.
If you try this, the odds are very good that you'll end up having to drop one of them. Make sure you are prepared to gamble with that $2000.

i highly highly DO NOT recommend this!!! both classes are very heavy during the summer (the pace is much faster during the semester). this will be a huge huge time commitment and personally i think the burnout it may cause is not worth it

history.content:
Hi, I'm a newly admitted eecs transfer.
I'll be taking 61A and 70 over the summer, and I was looking for some students who are planning to do the same thing.
As it will be intense, I assume 12 ~ 14hrs of work every day for 8 weeks, I thought it would be nice to have someone to work together.
Please shoot me an email if interested: kei0112777 at g ma il. COM

By the way, can anyone recommend a resource I can take advantage to increase my chance of going through this?
For an instance, is HKN tutor or office hours available during the summer?
history.subject: Taking CS61A and CS70 over the Summer
